ratings.comment: There are lots to do for this class. We had weekly lab reports (typed, 5-6 pages), problem sets and occasional online chem tutors too. The grading criteria were clear, and tests were fair as long as you participated in class and did the homework. One thing I really didn't like was the CPR cuz people are unnecessarily brutal to get your scores lower

Prof Moore is a very nice person and it's clear that he's very passionate about what he teaches. He makes good use of demos which are interesting. The biggest flaw is how the course is laid out because it's not taught well. Trying to figure out what to write for lab reports is very hard. Exams are hard and aren't relevant to class material.

Moore obviously really cares about teaching. He really wants you to learn the information and enjoy the class. Despite liking him as a person, he seems a little disconnected with students on the amount of work he assigns. This class takes a TON of time. Weekly lab reports, tutorials, and problem sets are a lot to manage.

This class was super tough, but Prof. Moore really is a wonderful professor. He genuinely cares about your learning, and is very knowledgeable and willing to help if you ask for it. I would highly recommend not taking this course unless you have taken AP Chem. I can't imagine someone keeping up with the material without previous exposure.

Professor Moore is probably the best professor I've had here. The lectures are super clear and organized, and he does enough demos to keep them interesting and fun. The exams can be challenging and require you to think somewhat outside of the box, but he makes the class really enjoyable.

Chem 109: Great professor. Very understandable and funny. He writes the textbook. Read the textbook and do the homework and you'll get a B. Tough class but if work is put in it is doable. Tips: Take good lecture notes, read textbook, do well in lab to boost your grade.

Prof Moore is very clear in his lectures. He is also very willing to help you out if you have questions or need clarification. It is a big class and hard to teach but Prof Moore did a great job! His tests are challenging but not impossible. Just pay attention to book and material and you will be fine in his class!

Great lectures, cares for all students, and is completely fair. You can make it through chem 109 as long as you put in the effort. If you suck at chem, just go to office hours and actually read the book.
Great Professor overall. I have no complaints about his teaching style. He was very clear and organized. He has a dad-joke sense of humor. The demos during class were pretty great all semester.
good
Lectures were always interesting. He gave great demonstrations and was easy to understand. Best chem prof I ever had.

Very glad I had Moore for Chem 109.  He's an older guy, but a great professor with incredible handwriting, and you can tell he definitely has the respect of all his students.  The tests are difficult, so you need to put forth the effort in this class to end up with a good grade.  There is a pretty generous curve at the end, though.
John Moore is my hero.  I would highly recommend taking his class.  You will learn to love him, and it's not a hard A if you put the work in.
Chem109 was my favorite class first semester and a lot of that can be attributed to Professor Moore, he was hands down the best prof I had.

Professor Moore is a great professor with about 5 demos per class period. He is always well prepared, organized, and has clear grading criteria. The class and workload is overwhelming at first, but stick with it, its worth it. Don't get too worried about your grade as there is a huge curve at the end of the course.

Professor Moore speaks clearly and has beautiful handwriting.  The class will be much easier if you read the textbook before lectures, but it makes you feel like you are gaining little from the lectures.  Our class loved him, and by the end of the semester, many wished he was their grandpa with his jokes and unbeatable charm.

I took AP Chem before Chem 109, and it definitely helped in understanding the material. Lectures may not be the most interesting all the time, but he lays out what you need to know very clearly, and the TAs take lecture notes that are available online after class. Use the Piazza forum- Moore often answers questions himself in a very timely manner!

Professor Moore is a great teacher and very knowledgable about the material. Best thing to do with understanding the material is to read the textbook and then go to lecture it makes everything more clear. The tests are hard and you have to study a lot for this class. I spent 90% of my time on Chemistry.

Professor Moore is an awesome professor - highly knowledgeable and very willing to offer help. He's super approachable during office hours and explains things very thoroughly. The class itself, however, is quite hard and definitely took up the majority of my time during the semester. Study from past/sample exams and do the book problems.

Very good teacher indeed. His lectures do tend to get a bit boring though. His experiments are very fun and Halloween was extreme with him. Very sweet and friendly. Answered questions personally after classes. Overall, really a good professor with a tough class.

Moore really knows what he's talking about, but his lectures do get a bit boring. He tries to keep them fun with demos and nerdy chemistry jokes. He's a really sweet guy who cares a lot about the success of his students.
He wrote the textbook and knows what he's talking about. Other than the course itself being fast paced and difficult, he's a fantastic professor.

Professor Moore is an amazing chem professor. He writes big enough that you can actually read it form the back of the lecture hall. He is very good at teaching and uses lots of demos but his lectures can be long. The Halloween and Christmas experiments are fun and a good review of everything you should have learned. Would recommend this professor

Professor Moore is honestly the best professor the chem department has. He was constantly doing demos and halloween with him is a treat! Chemistry can be hard but he does the best to explain the concepts clearly. His exams are straight forward if you study the materials. I would recommend taking a class with him.

Very nice guy, but lectures seem very long.  Uses examples to explain most concepts, which can be confusing at times.  Your TA will be your best friend for this class, so make sure to attend discussion.

Lectures were long and boring, but it's chemistry so that's expected.  He explained very complicated material simply which helped a lot.  The exams were very difficult and averages were 64%.  He says he doesn't curve the class but he ended up curving it a little bit in the end to compensate for the exam grades.  Lab and weekly homework boosts grade

He is an extremely boring lecturer. He is very very smart, but has a hard time making lectures interesting. Tests are hard but fair. If you study you will do just fine. All notes are online, so you don't have to go to lecture.

Professor Moore is a super nice person.  However, as a professor not so good.  His lectures are boring and can be confusing, he does a lot of experiments which are cool, but don't always help you understand what he's talking about.  His test are hard and he will test you on stuff that you didn't actually use(learn).  Hope you get a good TA!
Great professor for an intro chem class. Plenty of demos and he really wants his students to learn chemistry. Tests are a bit difficult, but homework and practice tests help a lot.

A truly outstanding instructor and one that I think only comes around once in a generation. Dr. Moore was well-prepared, had beautiful penmanship, had simple exams and was super helpful. He can be funny and is such a sweet man. Love this guy!!!

Wow this class is challenging. Be prepared to work very hard if you want an A. It's possible, but it is very difficult. Lectures are a hit or miss. You either learn really important stuff that will show up on the exams, or you will waste an entire period learning absolutely nothing useful. Moore is adorable though. He tries to keep it interesting.

Moore did a great job keeping me focused in class. He knows when his topics are getting boring, and he tries to add as many demos as possible, making it much easier to pay attention. Great professor, I would definitely recommend him.

If you can stay awake despite his monotone voice his lectures are pretty interesting.  His exams required effort, but actual good scores (not just good curved) weren't impossible if you studied the practice exams.

Explains concepts well, if you can stand the more boring parts of his lectures. His lectures are filled with demos in an attempt to keep things interesting, but when he actually explains concepts it's quite boring to listen to. Pretty cool halloween and christmas demos though. (*Professor walks in surrounded by fog with a wizard costume)

I came to this class with little prior Chemistry, but Professor Moore made the material interesting and easy to understand. This is a difficult class, and tests are hard, but if you apply yourself, you can get a good grade.

Really nice man, very willing to help. He has put a lot of effort into the course and it shows. It's a difficult class but if you apply yourself you'll gain a great depth in Chem. Tests are difficult. I recommend doing the study questions and practice tests on Moodle. Take the online homework seriously, it helps a lot with your understanding.

Moore is an awesome professor and person. Very entertaining during class and funny. His voice can often times put you to sleep, but his demonstrations always wake you up. Tests are hard and there is a lot of work for the class, but it's an awesome course.
He is a good teacher, but his voice can put students to sleep.  If you can stay awake and stay focused you will learn unbelievable amounts of chemistry.  He does lot of cool demos which help.

He's a older guy who really loves chemistry and it shows through his teaching. He makes lectures fun with a cool demo almost every day. I don't feel like I learn a lot from lecture but they are worth going to.

If you did not take AP Chem in High School, the pace of this course will be fairly challenging. The tests are not curved, but grades are adjusted (very) slightly at the end. Prof Moore is a really cool guy, but his lectures can get a little boring at times. If you're considering taking this class, definitely try to get him as your professor.
Moore is the man, when it comes to chemistry. He is very excited to teach and it is clear he cares about the students. Also, his corny jokes are the best!

Moore is an interesting Prof. I couldn't focus much as Chem 109 is basically AP Chem in 1 semester, so it was almost all review. He has occasional demos which makes class more interesting. Tests are hard and require studying. He gives you a note card so its not awful. Tries to make class interesting, but if you've taken AP, it will be boring.

Professor Moore is a great teacher. Although, the lectures can get kind of boring so drink coffee ahead of time! My favorite part is when he does demos during class. He relates them to what we're discussing in lecture. A very fast paced class with labs every week. The tests can get really hard so spend a lot of time studying and start early!!
He teaches students to think critically and exams are quite easy and straightforward.
John Moore is a really nice guy, but he's an extremely boring lecturer.  The overall course is challenging, but that should be expected.  The tests weren't too bad as long as you studied a lot.

Great professor! Truly loves Chemistry, and really wants his students to do well. Exams are fairly difficult, but go into his office hours and he will consider regrades/curves. Definitely learn a lot more in depth about chem from him. Very sweet man.

Relatively good professor.  Not a huge fan of his teaching style.  Rather then teach out of the textbook, he instead just gives a lot of demos and doesn't write much on the board so you have to take notes on what he says.  Ended up having to teach myself a lot by using the textbook

Professor Moore is a very nice guy and his love for chemistry is pretty obvious. Lectures can get really boring, though, and tests are extremely challenging. Homework is time consuming, but you get multiple tries.
Professor Moore is a really nice teacher. He is very good at explaining the materials in a rather clear way.My favorite part in this course is when he exploded the baloons. :)

While the class itself is tough, Professor Moore actually makes it bearable. It's possible to get a good grade in this class while sleeping through a few lectures as long as you do the work, take the homeworks seriously, and get lucky in the TA lottery.

Professor Moore knows everything that he is talking about. I have taken only one year of high school Chem and finished with an A in the class. However, you need to basically memorize the book in order to get an A. Labs and hw aren't bad, and tests are challenging.

Really nice guy who makes the material pretty easy.  His lectures are very similar to the book, but the book is a must.  Pay attention to the details and it makes the homeworks and challenge quizzes doable.  The exams are quite tough though.  Be sure to take advantage of the note card.

He is understandable but sooo boring.  Also, he talks kind of like Kermit the Frog, which can get irritating.  Still, he makes concepts pretty clear.  He wrote the textbook, but offers an online one for free, so that's pretty nice (they have different content though).

Really awesome teacher. You need to work hard in this class to get a good grade, but he really cares about making sure you understand the material. He keeps class interesting with a ton of demos. Tests are difficult but  manageable because he provides a study guide for each exam.

Absolutely the WORST teacher I have ever had and ever will have. Very nice man and you can tell he loves chemistry, but he doesn't actually feel the need to teach it. Lectures are entirely made up of random demos, which he expects you to know (about 10 from every lecture)details about for exams. Worthless as a teacher.

The class is tough but he doesn't try to make it worse.  Cares that his students learn the material above all.  If you are truly interested in chem he is a good professor. If you're forced to take this class he makes it the most managable.

Professor Moore has desire to help his students learn.  He is a great guy and you will not have any problems with him.  Easily approachable during office hours and promptly responds to questions through email.  Lecture gets boring, but if you understand what he is talking about they are helpful.  DO THE READING of assigned sections BEFORE lecture.

Super nice professor and very approachable. Reading the textbook is a must because he only breezes over the reading in lecture. Tests were fair but still hard, even with a notecard. He wants his students to learn, not memorize (provides equations and everything for exams). Would recommended to anyone who took AP Chem. (Try to stay up in lecture).
I will keep it short: 1) Very nice guy 2) Very tough class in my opinion a definition of a weed-out class 3) Very nice guy

Prof Moore was the best! He was great when you emailed him questions, and always had jokes and demos to keep lectures interesting! Exams were tough only if you don't pay attention to his hilarious lectures!! LOVE JW MOORE!

Professor Moore is a funny old guy who enjoys doing science experiments off the cuff in front of lecture.  He's great when it comes to day to day lecture (although some can get rather boring and drag on), but when it's test time, watch out.  They are super hard if you do not study well enough.  But, study hard and do well in lab to get at least a B
I found the lectures very boring to be honest and the exams were very difficult.

A pretty good professor. His lectures were okay, a lot of times it was hard to keep focused because it got dull (and I like chemistry). Do well on online hws/quizzes, they really add up. The midterms were all relatively easy but the final seemed to be harder. I used the Kotz textbook which was helpful. An A is definitely attainable.

Lectures were sometimes boring but that is the nature of the material he covers, he did a lot to make it enjoyable such as dancing, lots of fun demos, and he was always cracking jokes.  Homework and exams were fair, one of the best professors I've had here.

SUPER hard class but a REALLY GOOD professor.  Devotes fridays to answering questions and I really suggest you email him any questions you have and he will answer them.  You have to go to pretty much every lecture, no slides are posted online.  It's technically not necessary to read the book but it can really help with homework and clarifying

Prof Moore is one of the nicest teachers at UW-Madison. He knows his stuff, and is able to teach it to you well. Tests are very straight-forward, and pretty fair. Lectures were boring sometimes, but that's chemistry. Overall great guy, so glad I took him for 104.

He is a TERRIBLE lecturer. I know there is a lot of material and it is quite dull, but other professors are just better at explaining. He does have some fun demos and his dancing is hilarious, but as far as teaching the material i think he did a poor job.
Lectures were extremely dull and boring except when he did some explosions. But he is a friendly helpful one and he loves to dance!

Theres lots of cool explosions and demonstrations in lecture. Professor Moore cares about his students and really tries to help you out.  Do well on the hmwk, labs, and quizzes, becuase they can boost your grade a lot! Its a difficult class that runs really fast, so put a good amount of time into it studying. The curve at the end helps too.

Awesome professor. Really cares about how students perform in the class. Downside was lectures are pretty much identical to the reading because he wrote the textbook so it was always tempting to skip.
This was the greatest professor! I had a lot of fun in his class! Lots of explosions!!

His lectures were pretty dull, though his demonstrations were always interesting, and he has a great sense of humor.  You can also tell that he respects his student.  The coursework is pretty difficult, though grading isn't so bad as to make this a grade-killer.
Nice prof!!!The class is extremely interesting. He likes to dance...

Sweetest man, and he cares about students! Take the online HW/quizzes seriously, they're grade boosters! You do them at your leisure and with materials, so go over them with your TA. His lecture covers what he wants to cover, so you should read the book. His exams were tough (averages of D,C,C) but fair. Study hard and be above the average for an A
Good professor. You can tell he's been doing this for a long time. Sometimes his lectures can be a bit boring though. Exams could be pretty difficult.

He's very amusing when doing the demonstrations. I love his lectures although sometimes it can be a little boring. He's good at explaining the concepts and willing to help when you have questions. I think his exams are reasonable, but you still need to study hard for them.

Prof JMoore obviously puts his heart and soul into this class. He loves Gen Chem. His demonstrations were amusing but sometimes his lectures were a little dull. I hated the online textbook (use the hardcover, it's much better) and wished the homework were longer, with more problems to reflect test questions.

he's old, has a bald spot, and does cool demos. he does not speak in monotone or is boring like the dumbass claims below, who obviously doesn't understand the class at all. take his class it's an easy A if you've taken AP chem because it's 75% old material.

His exams are extremely hard and his lectures do not cover most of what is on them.  His demos do not help and the labs for the class are ridiculously long and hard.  If you want to lower you GPA or get kicked in the b@lls then take this class.  He will help on simple questions but will only direct you to better ways of answering your questions.
Exams were extremely hard. Make sure you read the book and know it like the back of your hand!

The professor truly wants you to understand the fundamentals of chemistry. Upon which you can build upon as you take higher level courses.Honors project is easy points so definitely take the class for honors. Overall great personality and if you want to get an A be involved in discussions and ask for help the moment you get lost. Don't procrastinat

lectures are incredibly hard to stay awake in because he speaks in monotone. However, he is very intelligent and fun with the demos. He is one of the professors that truly enjoys interacting with the students. You HAVE TO read the book and do additional exercises on the side to keep up. Take him if others are filled up b.c. honors = hard curve.

I wish I had a different prof.  He talks straight out of the book, which he wrote.  A few times in lecture, he screwed up formulas and definitions.  He does do interesting demos during lecture, but they have no impact on exams or homework.  Homework is entirely online and is the worst setup ever.  Exams are rough and evil!

Excellent lecturer. He does a lot of demonstrations, which keep class interesting. There is a good amount of work involved and exams are pretty tough. Don't expect to do well if you're not willing to put in the work. But, I would definitely recommend him- you come out having learned a lot.

He was a really good lecturer, but you have to do a lot of outside work to keep up with the class. He loves to use outside sources and loves to make you do them too, so the workload is intense. But I definitely suggest it because you'll come out of the class 10x smarter than those who took the 103-104 sequence
cool demos, lecture is well organized, he explains them well, you can understand him perfectly, and he answers email!!

Tries to keep lecture intestering with fun experiments, but the exams are really hard. The exams are made by the TA's so really, the exams vary from year to year. There's always bound to be one question where a TA was trying too hard and they make it too difficult or over-ambigious.
Knows what he's talking about and explains it well but Chem 109H is a hard class. You NEED to study for the tests!

Nice guy, but he teaches straight out of the book, especially since he wrote it.  His exams are difficult and you will definitely see things on there that you have never seen before, which sucks because the exams are not curved.  If you are pre-med, take 103-104 instead...otherwise you'll have to take Analytical Chemistry.

Very good professor.  Very clear speaker and neatest handwriting of any professor.  Tests are hard, but not ridiculous.  Lectures are usually entertaining and helpful.  Tough class though.  Cover a lot of material in one semester.  Honors project is stupid, but an easy A for an assignment.  Great professor, very approachable.  Take him.

He's a nice guy and I guess a good teacher, but this is an incredibly hard class.  Also, if you are pre-med, don't take 109 because you'll still have to take another chem course like analytical or inorganic.  You're much better off taking 103-104.
Kept class interesting and easy to follow
Really nice guy, with good demos. Keeps the class entertained most of the time. Only downside was the difficulty of exams.
Very difficult exams, but lectures are well outlined and very understandable.  Very enjoyable overall.
This class was hard.  A lot harder than I expected.  It is managable though.  The tests are really hard and are nothing like what you are told to study.

Moore is a very good teacher. He writes everything on the board and explains the concepts well. He also does several quick demonstations each day to aid in his lecture. The class overall is somewhat difficult. Multiple years of Chem in highschool help.

He is a very nice man. He has a ton of experience teaching chemistry so his methods are pretty organized. He also wrote the textbook you use for his class...so you should probably read it! This class is really HARD!!! He expects a lot out of his students, but he is a reasonable grader.

He's a nice guy and a good teacher but the class is hard.  If you get a hard TA your labs will be hell, overall it is a real hard class, if you didn't have ap chem in high school, (and probably even if you did) the class will take over your life and make it hell

His lectures were very organized and clear. He has the neatest handwriting I have ever seen and writes down almost every thing he says so its really easy to take notes. The tests aren't very hard because there is no curve. Work hard on the homework and labs and it is easy to do well. A LOT of work but DEFINETILY worth it.
He was very helpful and his lectures were very intesting.  It's a really tough class, but it was worth it.
